alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 6:16AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Patchy Drizzle and Freezing Drizzle possible for portions of far northeast Alabama and adjacent middle Tennessee... Patchy drizzle and some freezing drizzle is possible, mainly in the higher elevations of Franklin, Jackson, and DeKalb counties this morning. Visibilities locally could be reduced to one quarter of a mile in spots. Air temperatures were hovering in the lower 30s, therefore some of the drizzle could freeze on elevated surfaces. Temperatures warming above freezing should help alleviate the threat after 9 AM this morning. Motorists are urged to drive with extreme caution, as visibilities will vary significantly given the patchy nature of the fog. Use low beams, reduce driving speed, and allow for plenty of room between you and other vehicles. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio, or a favorite local media outlet, for further statements or updates from the National Weather Service in Huntsville.
